executiveSummary.problemStatement: Many individuals and small teams struggle with keeping track of their daily tasks and priorities, often relying on scattered notes or overly complex project management tools. Current solutions are either too basic (like simple to-do lists) or too complex (like enterprise project management software), leaving users without an intuitive middle ground that balances simplicity with essential productivity features.
executiveSummary.targetUsers: Individual professionals, freelancers, students, and small team members (2-5 people) who need a straightforward way to organize and track their personal or collaborative tasks without the complexity of enterprise-level project management tools. Primary users are tech-comfortable individuals aged 22-45 who value clean interfaces and efficient workflows.
executiveSummary.valueProposition: TaskFlow provides the perfect balance between simplicity and functionality, offering an intuitive task management experience that helps users stay organized without overwhelming them with unnecessary features or complex interfaces.
executiveSummary.missionStatement: To help individuals and small teams achieve their goals through simple, effective task organization and tracking.

mvpValidationGoals.description: Validate user engagement with core task management features
mvpValidationGoals.successIndicator: 70% of registered users create at least 5 tasks within their first week

mvpValidationGoals.description: Confirm users find value in the simplicity-focused approach
mvpValidationGoals.successIndicator: Average session duration of 8+ minutes with 3+ return visits per week

mvpValidationGoals.description: Ensure the app performs reliably across different devices and browsers
mvpValidationGoals.successIndicator: 99% uptime with page load times under 2 seconds

explicitNonGoals: Advanced project management features (Gantt charts, resource allocation)
acceptanceCriteria: Users can create, edit, and delete tasks with title, description, and due date
Tasks can be organized into custom categories/lists
Users can mark tasks as complete and view completion history
Task priority levels can be set and visually distinguished
Users can search and filter tasks by various criteria
Application works responsively on desktop and mobile browsers

features.name: Task Creation and Management
features.description: Users can create tasks with essential details including title, description, due date, and priority level. This is the core functionality that enables users to capture and organize their work items. Tasks can be edited at any time and deleted when no longer needed. The interface emphasizes quick task entry to minimize friction in capturing thoughts and commitments.
features.userStory: As a user, I want to quickly create and manage tasks with relevant details so that I can capture all my work items in one place and keep track of what needs to be done.

acceptanceCriteria.given: I am on the main dashboard
acceptanceCriteria.when: I click the 'Add Task' button and fill in task details
acceptanceCriteria.then: a new task is created and appears in my task list

acceptanceCriteria.when: I click the edit button and modify task details
acceptanceCriteria.then: the task is updated with new information

acceptanceCriteria.given: I have a task I no longer need
acceptanceCriteria.when: I click the delete button and confirm
acceptanceCriteria.then: the task is permanently removed from my list

edgeCases: Empty task title should show validation error
Due dates in the past should show warning but allow creation
Very long descriptions should be truncated in list view but fully visible in detail view
Deleting a task should require confirmation to prevent accidental deletion

features.name: Task Organization with Lists/Categories
features.description: Users can create custom lists or categories to organize their tasks logically, such as 'Work', 'Personal', 'Shopping', etc. This feature helps users separate different areas of their life and maintain better focus. Lists can be created, renamed, and deleted, with tasks easily moved between lists. The system provides a default 'General' list for uncategorized tasks.
features.userStory: As a user, I want to organize my tasks into different lists or categories so that I can separate work from personal tasks and focus on specific areas of my life.

acceptanceCriteria.given: I am logged into the app
acceptanceCriteria.when: I create a new list with a name
acceptanceCriteria.then: the list appears in my navigation and I can add tasks to it

acceptanceCriteria.when: I drag a task from one list to another
acceptanceCriteria.then: the task moves to the new list and updates its category

acceptanceCriteria.when: I rename or delete the list
acceptanceCriteria.then: the changes are reflected immediately and tasks are handled appropriately

edgeCases: Deleting a list with tasks should prompt user to choose destination list or delete tasks
List names must be unique per user
Empty list names should not be allowed
Maximum of 20 lists per user to prevent overwhelming the interface

features.name: Task Status and Completion Tracking
features.description: Users can mark tasks as complete with a simple checkbox interaction, and completed tasks are visually distinguished (crossed out, grayed out). The system maintains a history of completed tasks that users can review for motivation and reference. Users can also mark tasks as incomplete if needed. A progress indicator shows completion percentage for each list.
features.userStory: As a user, I want to mark tasks as complete and see my progress so that I feel accomplished and can track what I've achieved over time.

acceptanceCriteria.when: I click the checkbox next to it
acceptanceCriteria.then: the task is marked as complete and moves to the completed section
I can see both pending and completed tasks with clear visual distinction

acceptanceCriteria.given: I want to see my progress
acceptanceCriteria.then: I can see the completion percentage and number of tasks completed

edgeCases: Completing a task should timestamp the completion
Users should be able to uncomplete a task if done accidentally
Completed tasks should be collapsible/expandable in the view
Very old completed tasks (30+ days) should be archived automatically

features.name: Priority Levels and Visual Indicators
features.description: Tasks can be assigned priority levels (High, Medium, Low) with distinct visual indicators such as colored tags or icons. High-priority tasks are prominently displayed and can be sorted to the top of lists. This feature helps users focus on what matters most and makes important deadlines visible at a glance. Priority can be changed at any time.
features.userStory: As a user, I want to set priority levels for my tasks so that I can focus on the most important items first and never miss critical deadlines.

acceptanceCriteria.given: I am creating or editing a task
acceptanceCriteria.then: the task displays with appropriate visual indicators for that priority

acceptanceCriteria.given: I have tasks with different priorities
acceptanceCriteria.then: I can easily distinguish between high, medium, and low priority tasks

acceptanceCriteria.given: I want to focus on important tasks
acceptanceCriteria.then: high-priority tasks appear at the top of the list

edgeCases: Tasks without assigned priority should default to 'Medium'
Priority indicators should be colorblind-friendly (use icons + colors)
Priority sorting should be secondary to due date sorting when both are applied
Bulk priority changes should be possible for multiple selected tasks

features.name: Search and Filter Functionality
features.description: Users can search tasks by title and description using a search bar, and filter tasks by various criteria including status (complete/incomplete), priority level, due date range, and list/category. Search results are highlighted and filters can be combined. This feature becomes essential as users accumulate more tasks and need to quickly find specific items.
features.userStory: As a user, I want to search and filter my tasks so that I can quickly find specific tasks or focus on particular types of work without scrolling through everything.

acceptanceCriteria.when: I type in the search bar
acceptanceCriteria.then: tasks matching my search terms are immediately filtered and highlighted

acceptanceCriteria.given: I want to focus on specific tasks
acceptanceCriteria.when: I apply filters for status, priority, or due date
acceptanceCriteria.then: only tasks matching those criteria are displayed

acceptanceCriteria.when: I want to see all tasks again
acceptanceCriteria.then: I can easily clear all filters with one click

edgeCases: Search should be case-insensitive and support partial matches
No search results should show helpful empty state message
Multiple filters should work together (AND logic)
Search and filter state should persist during the session
Special characters in search should be handled gracefully

features.name: Due Date Management and Reminders
features.description: Users can set due dates for tasks with a date picker interface. Tasks approaching their due dates are highlighted with visual indicators (different colors for overdue, due today, due this week). The dashboard shows an overview of upcoming deadlines. While email notifications are not in MVP scope, visual indicators provide adequate reminder functionality.
features.userStory: As a user, I want to set due dates for my tasks and see upcoming deadlines so that I never miss important commitments and can plan my work effectively.

acceptanceCriteria.given: I am creating or editing a task
acceptanceCriteria.when: I set a due date using the date picker
acceptanceCriteria.then: the task displays the due date and shows appropriate urgency indicators

acceptanceCriteria.given: I have tasks with various due dates
acceptanceCriteria.then: I can see which tasks are overdue, due today, or due soon with clear visual distinction

acceptanceCriteria.when: I look at my task lists
acceptanceCriteria.then: tasks are sorted with urgent items prominently displayed

edgeCases: Overdue tasks should be clearly marked with red indicators
Tasks due today should have prominent highlighting
Users should be able to remove due dates from tasks
Date picker should prevent selection of invalid dates
Time zones should be handled based on user's browser settings

coreFeatures.mvpScope: The MVP will focus on core task management functionality including creating, organizing, and tracking tasks with essential features like categories, priorities, due dates, and search/filter capabilities. The emphasis is on providing a clean, intuitive interface that works well across devices without overwhelming users with advanced features. User accounts and data persistence are included, but advanced collaboration, integrations, and notification systems are excluded from the initial release.

roles.name: Individual User
roles.description: Primary user who manages their own tasks and lists. Has full control over their personal workspace including creating, editing, and deleting tasks and categories.
permissions: Create, read, update, delete own tasks
Create, read, update, delete own lists/categories

keyFlows: New user onboarding: Sign up → Create first task → Organize into lists → Mark task complete
Daily task management: Login → Review dashboard → Add new tasks → Update existing tasks → Check off completed items
Weekly planning: Review completed tasks → Create tasks for upcoming week → Set priorities and due dates → Organize by categories

requirements: Web-based application accessible via modern browsers (Chrome, Firefox, Safari, Edge)
Responsive design that works on desktop, tablet, and mobile devices
Client-side data persistence using local storage with cloud sync capability
Fast loading times under 2 seconds for initial page load
Offline functionality for basic task operations
Cross-browser compatibility and accessibility compliance (WCAG 2.1 AA)
RESTful API architecture for future mobile app development

launchRequirements: All six core features implemented and tested
User registration and authentication system working
Responsive design verified on major devices and browsers
Data backup and recovery system in place
Basic error handling and loading states implemented
Privacy policy and terms of service published
Performance testing completed with acceptable load times
launchBlockers: Critical bugs that prevent core task creation or editing
Data loss issues or inability to save user data
Authentication system failures or security vulnerabilities
Application completely non-functional on mobile devices
Search functionality returning incorrect or no results
Server infrastructure unable to handle expected user load
